channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: ABS-CBN shutdown robs ordinary Filipinos source of information, entertainment — urban poor group
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Rights groups and media organizations earlier emphasized that access to credible information is crucial in addressing the spread of the virus that has already infected 10,343 people in the country.

item.title: Cayetano deflects ABS-CBN shutdown blame to NTC, Calida
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Finally on Friday, the House Speaker broke his silence and vowed that there will be “reckoning” for the “flip-flopping of the NTC and the unconstitutional meddling by the Solicitor General in the business of Congress.”

item.title: Carpio: China’s naming of sea features doesn’t mean sovereignty
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: China’s naming of features in the South China Sea, including islands in the Philippine-held Kalayaan Island Group, does not matter since names of the geologic features do not determine sovereignty, retired Supreme Court senior associate justice Antonio Carpio said.

item.title: 1,500 workers needed to operate swab testing centers
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The government needs about 1,500 workers to ensure the full operation of the mega swabbing facilities in Metro Manila, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday.

item.title: CBCP bares ‘new normal’ protocol in religious rites
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The placing of footbaths in all churches and the mandatory wearing of face masks will become part of the “new normal” during religious services of the Archdiocese of Manila if the enhanced community quarantine is lifted on May 15.

item.title: Multi-awarded director Peque Gallaga dies
item.author: Ricky Lo
item.description: Acclaimed movie director Peque Gallaga died of pneumonia yesterday morning in his hometown in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental.

item.title: ‘Just pass a law to save ABS-CBN’
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Retired Supreme Court senior associate justice Antonio Carpio advised Congress to pass legislation to renew the franchise of broadcast giant ABS-CBN, saying a joint resolution is not a law.

item.title: NAIA ready for flights carrying OFWs, essential supplies
item.author: Rudy Santos
item.description: The Manila International Airport Authority will allow “upon approval of the government” all inbound flights carrying Filipino workers stranded abroad, medical supplies and food to land at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport starting today.

item.title: Cash aid distribution deadline extended anew
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: With the distribution of emergency cash assistance still incomplete after yesterday’s deadline, the Department of the Interior and Local Government is giving local authorities three more days or until May 10 to finish the payout of the social amelioration program.

item.title: Palace: Duterte to sign network’s franchise bill if…
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Amid the controversy, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. yesterday assured the public that President Duterte would sign the franchise bill for ABS-CBN once it gets the approval of the House of Representatives and the Senate.
